quality_assessment: The introduction is well-structured and comprehensive, but contains significant inaccuracies regarding language support, missing coverage of several major features, and makes false claims about capabilities that don't exist in the codebase

issues.description: Documentation incorrectly claims multi-language support (Rust, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Go) when only Rust and Python are implemented
issues.current_content: Introduction line 13: 'Debtmap analyzes Rust codebases...' (accurate) but features.json line 9 claims 'Multi-language code analysis (Rust, Python)' without JavaScript/TypeScript
issues.should_be: The introduction should clarify that only Rust is fully supported currently, with Python having basic support. The 'Current Status' section (lines 15-27) correctly states Rust-only focus but conflicts with earlier feature claims.
issues.fix_suggestion: Update the feature description to accurately reflect Rust-first focus with experimental Python support. Remove any implications of JavaScript/TypeScript/Go support.
issues.source_reference: src/organization/language.rs:3-6 (Language enum with only Rust and Python variants)

issues.description: Missing documentation for several major commands and features present in the codebase
features_not_documented: explain-coverage command (debugging tool for coverage detection)
God object detection and module split recommendations
Call graph debugging and validation capabilities
Parallel processing capabilities and performance benefits
issues.fix_suggestion: Add subsections under 'Key Features' or 'Commands' for these capabilities. The features.json includes comprehensive details for god_object_detection, boilerplate_detection, and functional_analysis that should be reflected in the introduction.
issues.source_reference: src/cli.rs:460-484 (ExplainCoverage command), features.json:240-327 (god object, boilerplate, functional analysis features)

issues.description: Missing explanation of explain-coverage command which is documented in CLI but not mentioned in introduction
issues.current_content: Commands section lists: analyze, validate, validate-improvement, compare, init
issues.should_be: Should include explain-coverage command: 'Debugging tool for coverage detection - explains function name matching and coverage data parsing'
issues.fix_suggestion: Add explain-coverage to the Commands section with brief description: 'explain-coverage - Debug coverage data parsing and function name matching'

issues.description: Claims '70% reduction in false positives' without source attribution or caveats about specific conditions
issues.current_content: Line 32: 'reducing false positives by up to 70% compared to traditional complexity-only analyzers'
issues.should_be: Should either provide source/methodology for the 70% claim or soften to 'significantly reduces false positives' without specific percentage
issues.fix_suggestion: Either add a reference to benchmarking methodology or change to: 'significantly reduces false positives compared to traditional complexity-only analyzers through advanced token classification and weighted entropy'
issues.source_reference: features.json:32 mentions entropy analysis and pattern detection but doesn't cite the 70% reduction metric

issues.description: Compare command documentation mentions --plan flag but doesn't explain what implementation plans are or how they work
issues.current_content: Line 43: 'compare command (which can use --plan to automatically extract target locations from implementation plans and track improvements)'
issues.should_be: Should either explain what implementation plans are or link to documentation about them, or simplify to just mention compare without the --plan detail
issues.fix_suggestion: Either add: 'compare command can track improvements and optionally extract target locations from implementation plan files' OR link to implementation plan documentation

issues.description: Missing quantified performance benefits that are documented in features.json
issues.current_content: Line 69: 'Built with Rust and Rayon for blazing-fast analysis'
issues.should_be: Should mention specific performance benefits: '70-90% speedup on multi-core systems, 10-100x faster than Java/Python competitors'
issues.fix_suggestion: Expand performance section to: 'Built with Rust and Rayon for blazing-fast parallel analysis (70-90% speedup on multi-core systems, 10-100x faster than Java/Python-based tools)'

issues.description: Missing threshold presets feature which is a key usability feature
issues.current_content: Threshold presets are mentioned briefly in line 52 but not in the Commands or Key Features sections with proper detail
issues.should_be: Should have dedicated mention: 'Threshold presets (strict, balanced, lenient) for quick configuration matching different project quality standards'
issues.fix_suggestion: Add to Configuration & Customization section or create a separate bullet for threshold management

positive_aspects: Clear and engaging introduction that explains value proposition well
Good 'Current Status' section that sets accurate expectations about Rust-first focus
Excellent 'Why Use Debtmap' section with concrete benefits and use cases
Strong 'Target Audience' section with specific examples for each user type
Well-organized 'Key Features' section with logical groupings
Good use of concrete metrics ('reduce complexity by 60%', '6 unit tests for full coverage')
Appropriate 'Getting Started' section with helpful navigation links
All internal documentation links are valid (verified: prodigy-integration.md, getting-started.md, analysis-guide.md, output-formats.md)
improvement_suggestions: Reconcile the conflict between 'Current Status' (Rust-only) and earlier implications of multi-language support
Add a 'Major Features at a Glance' section highlighting god object detection, boilerplate detection, and functional analysis
Include explain-coverage in the Commands section
Provide more detail on comparison workflow and implementation plan integration
Add a brief mention of parallel processing performance benefits earlier in the introduction
Consider adding a visual diagram or feature matrix for quick reference
Soften or substantiate the '70% false positive reduction' claim with methodology reference
Add brief explanation of threshold presets in the getting started tip

metadata.validation_focus: Ensure introduction covers project purpose and main features
